20...Qxd6?? loses to 21 Nxe6 Rxe6 22 Qxg7  Ke8  with mate coming in a few moves.  The correct move for me was 20 Nxe6 and after 20...Bxe6 21 Rxe6 Qf7 22 Nxd6 and either the queen dies or black gets checkmated.  I did not see this because I has to play fast in time pressure.

At this point in the game I am up the exchange and soon a bishop. Even though I have about 2:30 on my clock, I have a 5 second delay and I usually get low on time.  If I don't blunder my queen, this game is won.

This move is not good for black since it blocks the king's only escape square.  Black will probably have to sac his queen now.  My opponent was a very fast mover and still had about 20 minutes on his clock.

My opponent appeared to have played a lot of blitz and played very fast the whole game and missed a lot of tactics.  With me, the last tournament I had played in was the washington open.  A G30 compared to that is like a blitz game.  Even though I ran low on time, I stopped to think about my moves and led a great attack the whole game.
